name: Aripiprazole LAI (Abilify Maintena)
summary: A long-acting injectable formulation of aripiprazole used for maintenance treatment of schizophrenia and bipolar I disorder.
description: Abilify Maintena is a long-acting injectable (LAI) formulation of aripiprazole, an atypical antipsychotic. It delivers sustained aripiprazole plasma levels for approximately one month, improving adherence in patients with schizophrenia or bipolar I disorder. Its mechanism of action involves partial agonism at dopamine D2 and serotonin 5-HT1A receptors and antagonism at serotonin 5-HT2A receptors.

contraindications: Known hypersensitivity to aripiprazole or formulation excipients

sections.text: Partial agonist at dopamine D2 and serotonin 5-HT1A receptors and antagonist at serotonin 5-HT2A receptors, providing dopaminergic and serotonergic modulation.

adult.titrate: May reduce to 300 mg monthly if not tolerated

sections.geriatric: Same dosing; monitor for orthostatic hypotension and sedation
sections.hepatic_impairment: No adjustment in mild/moderate; use caution in severe

items: Pre-filled syringes or vials for intramuscular injection: 300 mg, 400 mg

sections.text: Steady-state plasma concentrations achieved after 4 doses; effects maintained for approximately 4 weeks.

sections.black_box: Increased mortality in elderly patients with dementia-related psychosis.
other: Ensure oral aripiprazole tolerability before initiating LAI
Overlap with oral aripiprazole for 14 days after first injection

sections.pregnancy: Use only if benefits outweigh risks; monitor neonates for EPS or withdrawal.
sections.lactation: Excreted in breast milk; monitor infant for sedation.
sections.geriatrics: Monitor for increased sensitivity to side effects.

sections.text: Not applicable for LAI; discontinue with clinical monitoring due to gradual drug elimination.

items: Oral supplementation required for the first 14 days after initiation.
Monthly injection can improve adherence in patients with poor compliance to oral medication.
Well tolerated with lower metabolic burden compared to some other LAIs.
